info.name: Appointment360 API
info.description: Postman collection for the Appointment360 FastAPI backend. Includes v1 endpoints (Contacts, Imports) and v2 endpoints (Authentication, Users, AI Chat, Apollo). All endpoints require Bearer token authentication. Sample parameters align with docs/apis.md, docs/api/user.md, docs/api/ai_chat.md, and docs/api/apollo.md.

item.name: System

item.name: Authentication

header.description: Expected response content type.
Request body content type. Required for POST/PUT requests with JSON bodies.
Optional: Origin header for CORS testing. Enable this header to verify CORS response headers (Access-Control-Allow-Origin, etc.). Disabled by default since Postman doesn't enforce CORS.

request.description:
Register a new user account and receive access tokens. A user profile is automatically created upon registration.

**Field Requirements:**
- name (string, required): User's full name (max 255 characters)
- email (string, required): Valid email address (must be unique)
- password (string, required): Password (min 8 characters, max 72 characters due to bcrypt limitation)

**Response Codes:**
- 201 Created: Registration successful
- 400 Bad Request: Invalid request data, email already exists, or password validation failed

header.description: Expected response content type.
Request body content type. Required for POST/PUT requests with JSON bodies.
Optional: Origin header for CORS testing. Enable this header to verify CORS response headers (Access-Control-Allow-Origin, etc.). Disabled by default since Postman doesn't enforce CORS.

request.description:
Authenticate a user and receive access tokens. Updates the user's last_sign_in_at timestamp upon successful login.

**Field Requirements:**
- email (string, required): User's email address (must be valid email format)
- password (string, required): User's password

**Response Codes:**
- 200 OK: Login successful
- 400 Bad Request: Invalid credentials, missing fields, or account disabled

header.description: Expected response content type.
JWT Bearer token for authentication. Obtained from login or register endpoints.
Optional: Origin header for CORS testing. Enable this header to verify CORS response headers (Access-Control-Allow-Origin, etc.). Disabled by default since Postman doesn't enforce CORS.

request.description: Get the current authenticated user's session information. Useful for checking token validity.

header.description: Expected response content type.
Request body content type. Required for POST/PUT requests with JSON bodies.
Optional: Origin header for CORS testing. Enable this header to verify CORS response headers (Access-Control-Allow-Origin, etc.). Disabled by default since Postman doesn't enforce CORS.

request.description:
Refresh an expired access token using a refresh token. Returns new access and refresh tokens (token rotation).

**Request Body:**
- refresh_token (string, required): Valid refresh token

**Response Codes:**
- 200 OK: Token refresh successful
- 400 Bad Request: Invalid or expired refresh token

header.description: Expected response content type.
Request body content type. Required for POST/PUT requests with JSON bodies.
JWT Bearer token for authentication. Obtained from login or register endpoints.
Optional: Origin header for CORS testing. Enable this header to verify CORS response headers (Access-Control-Allow-Origin, etc.). Disabled by default since Postman doesn't enforce CORS.

request.description:
Logout the current user and invalidate refresh token. Logout succeeds even if refresh token is not provided.

**Request Body:**
- refresh_token (string, optional): Refresh token to blacklist. If not provided, logout still succeeds.

**Response Codes:**
- 200 OK: Logout successful

item.description: User authentication endpoints for registration, login, logout, token refresh, and session management.

item.name: Users

header.description: Expected response content type.
JWT Bearer token for authentication. Obtained from login or register endpoints.
Optional: Origin header for CORS testing. Enable this header to verify CORS response headers (Access-Control-Allow-Origin, etc.). Disabled by default since Postman doesn't enforce CORS.

request.description: Get the profile information for the currently authenticated user. If a profile doesn't exist, it will be automatically created with default values.

header.description: Expected response content type.
Request body content type. Required for POST/PUT requests with JSON bodies.
JWT Bearer token for authentication. Obtained from login or register endpoints.
Optional: Origin header for CORS testing. Enable this header to verify CORS response headers (Access-Control-Allow-Origin, etc.). Disabled by default since Postman doesn't enforce CORS.

request.description:
Update the profile information for the currently authenticated user. All fields are optional - only provided fields will be updated (partial update).

**Optional Fields:**
- name (string, optional, max 255 chars): User's full name
- job_title (string, optional, max 255 chars): User's job title
- bio (string, optional): User's biography (text field)
- timezone (string, optional, max 100 chars): User's timezone (e.g., "America/New_York")
- avatar_url (string, optional): URL to user's avatar image
- notifications (object, optional): User notification preferences (merged with existing preferences)
  - weeklyReports (boolean, optional): Enable/disable weekly reports
  - newLeadAlerts (boolean, optional): Enable/disable new lead alerts
- role (string, optional, max 50 chars): User's role

**Response Codes:**
- 200 OK: Profile updated successfully
- 400 Bad Request: Invalid data provided
- 401 Unauthorized: Authentication required

header.description: Expected response content type.
JWT Bearer token for authentication. Obtained from login or register endpoints.
Optional: Origin header for CORS testing. Enable this header to verify CORS response headers (Access-Control-Allow-Origin, etc.). Disabled by default since Postman doesn't enforce CORS.

formdata.description: Image file (JPEG, PNG, GIF, or WebP, max 5MB)

request.description:
Upload an avatar image file for the currently authenticated user.

**File Requirements:**
- File Types: JPEG, PNG, GIF, or WebP
- Maximum Size: 5MB
- Validation: Both file extension and file content (magic bytes) are validated

**Request:**
- Content-Type: multipart/form-data (automatically set by Postman)
- Body: Form-data with key "avatar" and type "file"

**Response Codes:**
- 200 OK: Avatar uploaded successfully
- 400 Bad Request: Invalid file type or size
- 401 Unauthorized: Authentication required
- 500 Internal Server Error: Error saving file

header.description: Expected response content type.
JWT Bearer token for authentication. Obtained from login or register endpoints.
Optional: Origin header for CORS testing. Enable this header to verify CORS response headers (Access-Control-Allow-Origin, etc.). Disabled by default since Postman doesn't enforce CORS.

request.description:
Promote the currently authenticated user to admin role.

**Request:**
- No request body required
- Uses the authenticated user from the Bearer token

**Response Codes:**
- 200 OK: User promoted to admin successfully
- 401 Unauthorized: Authentication required
- 400 Bad Request: User account is disabled
- 404 Not Found: User not found
- 500 Internal Server Error: Failed to promote user to admin

**Notes:**
- This endpoint allows authenticated users to change their role to "Admin"
- The operation is logged for audit purposes
- If a profile doesn't exist, it will be automatically created with default values before promotion

item.description: User profile management endpoints for retrieving, updating profiles, uploading avatars, and promoting users to admin.

item.name: AI Chat

header.description: Expected response content type.
JWT Bearer token for authentication. Obtained from login or register endpoints.
Optional: Origin header for CORS testing. Enable this header to verify CORS response headers (Access-Control-Allow-Origin, etc.). Disabled by default since Postman doesn't enforce CORS.

query.description: Number of results per page (default: 25, max: 100)
Order by field. Prepend '-' for descending. Valid: created_at, updated_at, -created_at, -updated_at (default: -created_at)

request.description:
Get a list of all AI chat conversations for the current user with pagination.

**Query Parameters:**
- limit (integer, optional): Number of results per page (default: 25, max: 100)
- offset (integer, optional): Offset for pagination (default: 0)
- ordering (string, optional): Order by field. Prepend '-' for descending. Valid fields: created_at, updated_at, -created_at, -updated_at (default: -created_at)

**Response Codes:**
- 200 OK: Chat history retrieved successfully
- 401 Unauthorized: Authentication required

header.description: Expected response content type.
Request body content type. Required for POST/PUT requests with JSON bodies.
JWT Bearer token for authentication. Obtained from login or register endpoints.
Optional: Origin header for CORS testing. Enable this header to verify CORS response headers (Access-Control-Allow-Origin, etc.). Disabled by default since Postman doesn't enforce CORS.

request.description:
Create a new AI chat conversation.

**Field Requirements:**
- title (string, optional): Chat title (max 255 characters, default: empty string)
- messages (array, optional): List of messages (default: empty list)

**Message Format:**
Each message must be an object with:
- sender (string, required): Must be either "user" or "ai"
- text (string, required): Message text content
- contacts (array, optional): Array of contact objects when AI returns search results

**Response Codes:**
- 201 Created: Chat created successfully
- 400 Bad Request: Invalid request data
- 401 Unauthorized: Authentication required

header.description: Expected response content type.
JWT Bearer token for authentication. Obtained from login or register endpoints.
Optional: Origin header for CORS testing. Enable this header to verify CORS response headers (Access-Control-Allow-Origin, etc.). Disabled by default since Postman doesn't enforce CORS.

request.description:
Get detailed information about a specific AI chat conversation, including all messages.

**Path Parameters:**
- id (string, UUID): Chat ID

**Response Codes:**
- 200 OK: Chat retrieved successfully
- 401 Unauthorized: Authentication required
- 403 Forbidden: User does not own this chat
- 404 Not Found: Chat not found

header.description: Expected response content type.
Request body content type. Required for POST/PUT requests with JSON bodies.
JWT Bearer token for authentication. Obtained from login or register endpoints.
Optional: Origin header for CORS testing. Enable this header to verify CORS response headers (Access-Control-Allow-Origin, etc.). Disabled by default since Postman doesn't enforce CORS.

request.description:
Update an existing AI chat conversation (typically to add new messages or update the title). All fields are optional - only provided fields will be updated.

**Path Parameters:**
- id (string, UUID): Chat ID

**Field Requirements:**
All fields are optional:
- title (string, optional): Chat title (max 255 characters)
- messages (array, optional): Complete list of messages (replaces existing messages)

**Message Format:**
Each message must be an object with:
- sender (string, required): Must be either "user" or "ai"
- text (string, required): Message text content
- contacts (array, optional): Array of contact objects when AI returns search results

**Response Codes:**
- 200 OK: Chat updated successfully
- 400 Bad Request: Invalid request data
- 401 Unauthorized: Authentication required
- 403 Forbidden: User does not own this chat
- 404 Not Found: Chat not found

header.description: Expected response content type.
JWT Bearer token for authentication. Obtained from login or register endpoints.
Optional: Origin header for CORS testing. Enable this header to verify CORS response headers (Access-Control-Allow-Origin, etc.). Disabled by default since Postman doesn't enforce CORS.

request.description:
Delete an AI chat conversation.

**Path Parameters:**
- id (string, UUID): Chat ID

**Response Codes:**
- 204 No Content: Chat deleted successfully
- 401 Unauthorized: Authentication required
- 403 Forbidden: User does not own this chat
- 404 Not Found: Chat not found

**Notes:**
- Only the chat owner can delete their chats
- Deletion is permanent and cannot be undone
- The response has no body (204 No Content)

item.description: AI chat conversation endpoints for listing, creating, retrieving, updating, and deleting chat conversations. All endpoints require JWT authentication and verify ownership before allowing access.

item.name: Apollo

header.description: Expected response content type.
Request body content type. Required for POST/PUT requests with JSON bodies.
JWT Bearer token for authentication. Obtained from login or register endpoints.
Optional: Origin header for CORS testing. Enable this header to verify CORS response headers (Access-Control-Allow-Origin, etc.). Disabled by default since Postman doesn't enforce CORS.

request.description:
Analyze an Apollo.io URL and return structured parameter breakdown.

This endpoint parses Apollo.io search URLs (typically from the People Search page) and extracts all query parameters, categorizing them into logical groups such as:
- Pagination (page numbers)
- Sorting (sort field and direction)
- Person Filters (titles, locations, seniorities, departments)
- Organization Filters (employee ranges, locations, industries, revenue)
- Email Filters (verification status, catch-all exclusion)
- Keyword Filters (organization keywords, search fields)
- And more...

**Important:** Industry Tag IDs (organizationIndustryTagIds[], organizationNotIndustryTagIds[]) are automatically converted to readable industry names in the API response.

The analysis includes:
- URL structure breakdown (base URL, hash path, query string)
- Categorized parameters with descriptions
- Parameter values (URL-decoded)
- Statistics about the search criteria

**Field Requirements:**
- url (string, required): Apollo.io URL to analyze (must be from apollo.io domain)

**Response Codes:**
- 200 OK: URL analyzed successfully
- 400 Bad Request: Invalid URL, not from Apollo.io domain, or missing URL field
- 401 Unauthorized: Authentication required
- 500 Internal Server Error: Error occurred while analyzing the URL

header.description: Expected response content type.
Request body content type. Required for POST/PUT requests with JSON bodies.
JWT Bearer token for authentication. Obtained from login or register endpoints.
Optional: Origin header for CORS testing. Enable this header to verify CORS response headers (Access-Control-Allow-Origin, etc.). Disabled by default since Postman doesn't enforce CORS.

query.description: Maximum number of results per page (>=1). If not provided, returns all matching contacts (no pagination limit).
When set to 'simple', returns ContactSimpleItem. Omit for full ContactListItem.
Include contacts whose company name matches (case-insensitive substring). Supports comma-separated values for OR logic.
Exclude contacts whose company name matches any provided value (case-insensitive). Can be provided multiple times.

request.description:
Search contacts using Apollo.io URL parameters. This endpoint converts an Apollo.io People Search URL into contact filter parameters and returns matching contacts from your database.

**Response Format:**
The endpoint returns an enhanced response that includes:
- Contact results (paginated list of ContactListItem or ContactSimpleItem)
- mapping_summary: Statistics about parameter mapping (total, mapped, unmapped counts)
- unmapped_categories: Detailed information about parameters that were not mapped, grouped by category with reasons

This transparency helps you understand which Apollo filters were applied and which were skipped.

**Parameter Mappings:**
- page → page
- sortByField + sortAscending → ordering (with '-' prefix for descending)
- personTitles[] → title (comma-separated for OR logic)
- personNotTitles[] → exclude_titles
- personSeniorities[] → seniority (comma-separated)
- personDepartmentOrSubdepartments[] → department (comma-separated)
- personLocations[] → contact_location (comma-separated)
- personNotLocations[] → exclude_contact_locations
- organizationNumEmployeesRanges[] → employees_min, employees_max
- organizationLocations[] → company_location (comma-separated)
- organizationNotLocations[] → exclude_company_locations
- revenueRange[min/max] → annual_revenue_min, annual_revenue_max
- contactEmailStatusV2[] → email_status (comma-separated)
- organizationIndustryTagIds[] → industries (Tag IDs converted to industry names from CSV)
- organizationNotIndustryTagIds[] → exclude_industries (Tag IDs converted to industry names from CSV)
- qOrganizationKeywordTags[] → keywords (comma-separated)
- qNotOrganizationKeywordTags[] → exclude_keywords
- qKeywords → search

**Unmapped Parameter Reasons:**
- ID-based filter (no name mapping available): None (industry tag IDs are now mapped using CSV lookup, technology UIDs are mapped to technologies_uids)
- Apollo-specific feature: Search lists, personas, intent, lookalike, market segments
- Unmapped filter: Job postings, trading status, email catch-all exclusion
- Keyword field control: Now mapped to keyword_search_fields and keyword_exclude_fields
- UI flag or advanced filter: tour, uniqueUrlId, includeSimilarTitles, etc.

**Request Body:**
- url (string, required): Apollo.io URL to convert and search

**Query Parameters:**
- limit (integer, optional, >=1): Maximum number of results per page. **If not provided, returns all matching contacts (no pagination limit).** When provided, limits results to the specified number (capped at MAX_PAGE_SIZE).
- offset (integer, optional, >=0): Starting offset for results (default: 0)
- cursor (string, optional): Opaque cursor token for pagination
- view (string, optional): When 'simple', returns ContactSimpleItem, otherwise ContactListItem
- include_company_name (string, optional): Include contacts whose company name matches (case-insensitive substring). Supports comma-separated values for OR logic.
- exclude_company_name (array of strings, optional): Exclude contacts whose company name matches any provided value (case-insensitive). Can be provided multiple times.

**Response Codes:**
- 200 OK: Contacts retrieved successfully with mapping metadata
- 400 Bad Request: Invalid URL, not from Apollo.io domain, or invalid filter parameters
- 401 Unauthorized: Authentication required
- 500 Internal Server Error: Error occurred while searching contacts

**Use Cases:**
1. Apollo to Database Migration: Convert Apollo searches to database queries seamlessly
2. Search Replication: Replicate Apollo.io searches in your own system with transparency
3. Workflow Integration: Integrate Apollo URLs with full visibility into parameter mapping
4. Parameter Analysis: Understand which Apollo filters are applicable to your database

header.description: Expected response content type.
Request body content type. Required for POST/PUT requests with JSON bodies.
JWT Bearer token for authentication. Obtained from login or register endpoints.
Optional: Origin header for CORS testing. Enable this header to verify CORS response headers (Access-Control-Allow-Origin, etc.). Disabled by default since Postman doesn't enforce CORS.

query.description: Include contacts whose company name matches (case-insensitive substring). Supports comma-separated values for OR logic.
Exclude contacts whose company name matches any provided value (case-insensitive). Can be provided multiple times.

request.description:
Count contacts matching Apollo.io URL parameters. This endpoint converts an Apollo.io People Search URL into contact filter parameters and returns the total count of matching contacts from your database.

**Response Format:**
Returns a simple count response:
```json
{
  "count": 1234
}
```

**Parameter Mappings:**
Same as `/api/v2/apollo/contacts` endpoint - all Apollo URL parameters are mapped to contact filters using the same logic.

**Request Body:**
- url (string, required): Apollo.io URL to convert and count

**Query Parameters:**
- include_company_name (string, optional): Include contacts whose company name matches (case-insensitive substring). Supports comma-separated values for OR logic.
- exclude_company_name (array of strings, optional): Exclude contacts whose company name matches any provided value (case-insensitive). Can be provided multiple times.

**Response Codes:**
- 200 OK: Count retrieved successfully
- 400 Bad Request: Invalid URL, not from Apollo.io domain, or invalid filter parameters
- 401 Unauthorized: Authentication required
- 500 Internal Server Error: Error occurred while counting contacts

**Use Cases:**
1. Quick Count Check: Get the total number of contacts matching an Apollo search before fetching results
2. Progress Tracking: Monitor how many contacts match specific criteria
3. Filter Validation: Verify that your Apollo URL filters are working as expected
4. Resource Planning: Estimate data volume before processing large result sets

item.name: Get Contact UUIDs from Apollo URL

header.description: Expected response content type.
Request body content type. Required for POST/PUT requests with JSON bodies.
JWT Bearer token for authentication. Obtained from login or register endpoints.
Optional: Origin header for CORS testing. Enable this header to verify CORS response headers (Access-Control-Allow-Origin, etc.). Disabled by default since Postman doesn't enforce CORS.

query.description: Include contacts whose company name matches (case-insensitive substring). Supports comma-separated values for OR logic.
Exclude contacts whose company name matches any provided value (case-insensitive). Can be provided multiple times.
Optional limit on number of UUIDs returned. If not provided, returns all matching UUIDs (unlimited).

request.description:
Get a list of contact UUIDs matching Apollo.io URL parameters. This endpoint converts an Apollo.io People Search URL into contact filter parameters and returns matching contact UUIDs from your database.

**Response Format:**
Returns count and list of UUIDs:
```json
{
  "count": 1234,
  "uuids": ["uuid1", "uuid2", "uuid3", ...]
}
```

**Parameter Mappings:**
Same as `/api/v2/apollo/contacts` endpoint - all Apollo URL parameters are mapped to contact filters using the same logic.

**Request Body:**
- url (string, required): Apollo.io URL to convert and search

**Query Parameters:**
- include_company_name (string, optional): Include contacts whose company name matches (case-insensitive substring). Supports comma-separated values for OR logic.
- exclude_company_name (array of strings, optional): Exclude contacts whose company name matches any provided value (case-insensitive). Can be provided multiple times.
- limit (integer, optional): Maximum number of UUIDs to return. If not provided, returns all matching UUIDs (unlimited).

**Response Codes:**
- 200 OK: UUIDs retrieved successfully
- 400 Bad Request: Invalid URL, not from Apollo.io domain, or invalid filter parameters
- 401 Unauthorized: Authentication required
- 500 Internal Server Error: Error occurred while retrieving UUIDs

**Use Cases:**
1. Bulk Operations: Get UUIDs for bulk updates or exports
2. Efficient Filtering: Retrieve only UUIDs without full contact data
3. Export Preparation: Get UUID list before exporting specific contact sets
4. Integration: Use UUIDs for downstream processing or API calls

item.description: Apollo.io integration endpoints for parsing Apollo search URLs and searching contacts using Apollo URL parameters. Includes URL analysis for parameter breakdown, contact search for converting Apollo searches to database queries, contact count for quick result estimation, and UUID retrieval for bulk operations.

item.name: Exports

header.description: Expected response content type.
Request body content type. Required for POST/PUT requests with JSON bodies.
JWT Bearer token for authentication. Obtained from login or register endpoints.
Optional: Origin header for CORS testing. Enable this header to verify CORS response headers (Access-Control-Allow-Origin, etc.). Disabled by default since Postman doesn't enforce CORS.

request.description:
Create a CSV export of selected contacts.

Accepts a list of contact UUIDs and generates a CSV file containing all contact, company, contact metadata, and company metadata fields. Returns a signed temporary download URL that expires after 24 hours.

**Field Requirements:**
- contact_uuids (array[string], required, min: 1): List of contact UUIDs to export

**CSV Fields Included:**
- Contact fields: uuid, first_name, last_name, company_id, email, title, departments, mobile_phone, email_status, text_search, seniority, created_at, updated_at
- Contact Metadata: linkedin_url, facebook_url, twitter_url, website, work_direct_phone, home_phone, city, state, country, other_phone, stage
- Company fields: uuid, name, employees_count, industries, keywords, address, annual_revenue, total_funding, technologies, text_search, created_at, updated_at
- Company Metadata: linkedin_url, facebook_url, twitter_url, website, company_name_for_emails, phone_number, latest_funding, latest_funding_amount, last_raised_at, city, state, country

**Response Codes:**
- 201 Created: Export created successfully
- 400 Bad Request: At least one contact UUID is required
- 401 Unauthorized: Authentication required
- 500 Internal Server Error: Failed to create export or generate CSV

**Notes:**
- The export is processed synchronously and returns immediately with a download URL
- The download URL expires after 24 hours
- If a contact UUID doesn't exist, it will be skipped (not cause the entire export to fail)
- Array fields (departments, industries, keywords, technologies) are formatted as comma-separated values in the CSV

header.description: Expected response content type. Use text/csv for CSV file download.
JWT Bearer token for authentication. Obtained from login or register endpoints.
Optional: Origin header for CORS testing. Enable this header to verify CORS response headers (Access-Control-Allow-Origin, etc.). Disabled by default since Postman doesn't enforce CORS.

request.description:
Download a CSV export file using a signed URL.

The token must be valid and the export must belong to the requesting user. The export must not have expired.

**Path Parameters:**
- export_id (string, UUID): Export ID

**Query Parameters:**
- token (string, required): Signed URL token for authentication. This token is included in the download_url returned by the Create Contact Export endpoint.

**Response Codes:**
- 200 OK: CSV file downloaded successfully
- 401 Unauthorized: Invalid or expired download token
- 403 Forbidden: Token does not match export or user
- 404 Not Found: Export not found or access denied, or export file not found
- 410 Gone: Export has expired
- 400 Bad Request: Export is not ready (status not completed)

**Notes:**
- The download URL expires after 24 hours from creation
- Only the user who created the export can download it
- The response is a CSV file with Content-Disposition header for file download
- Use the full download_url from the Create Contact Export response, which includes the token as a query parameter

header.description: Expected response content type.
Request body content type. Required for POST/PUT requests with JSON bodies.
JWT Bearer token for authentication. Obtained from login or register endpoints.
Optional: Origin header for CORS testing. Enable this header to verify CORS response headers (Access-Control-Allow-Origin, etc.). Disabled by default since Postman doesn't enforce CORS.

request.description:
Create a CSV export of selected companies.

Accepts a list of company UUIDs and generates a CSV file containing all company and company metadata fields. Returns a signed temporary download URL that expires after 24 hours.

**Field Requirements:**
- company_uuids (array[string], required, min: 1): List of company UUIDs to export

**CSV Fields Included:**
- Company fields: uuid, name, employees_count, industries, keywords, address, annual_revenue, total_funding, technologies, text_search, created_at, updated_at
- Company Metadata: linkedin_url, facebook_url, twitter_url, website, company_name_for_emails, phone_number, latest_funding, latest_funding_amount, last_raised_at, city, state, country

**Response Codes:**
- 201 Created: Export created successfully
- 400 Bad Request: At least one company UUID is required
- 401 Unauthorized: Authentication required
- 500 Internal Server Error: Failed to create export or generate CSV

**Notes:**
- The export is processed synchronously and returns immediately with a download URL
- The download URL expires after 24 hours
- If a company UUID doesn't exist, it will be skipped (not cause the entire export to fail)
- Array fields (industries, keywords, technologies) are formatted as comma-separated values in the CSV

header.description: Expected response content type.
JWT Bearer token for authentication. Obtained from login or register endpoints.
Optional: Origin header for CORS testing. Enable this header to verify CORS response headers (Access-Control-Allow-Origin, etc.). Disabled by default since Postman doesn't enforce CORS.

request.description:
List all exports for the current user.

Returns all exports created by the authenticated user, ordered by creation date (newest first). Includes both contact and company exports.

**Response Codes:**
- 200 OK: Exports listed successfully
- 401 Unauthorized: Authentication required
- 500 Internal Server Error: Failed to list exports

**Response Fields:**
- exports (array): List of export records, ordered by created_at descending
- total (integer): Total number of exports for the user

**Each export object contains:**
- export_id (string, UUID): Unique identifier for the export
- user_id (string): ID of the user who created the export
- export_type (string): Type of export - either "contacts" or "companies"
- contact_count (integer): Number of contacts in the export (0 for company exports)
- company_count (integer): Number of companies in the export (0 for contact exports)
- status (string): Export status - pending, completed, or failed
- created_at (datetime): When the export was created
- expires_at (datetime, optional): When the download URL expires
- download_url (string, optional): Signed download URL (null if export is not completed)

**Notes:**
- Returns all exports for the authenticated user, regardless of export type
- Exports are ordered by creation date, newest first
- Only exports created by the current user are returned
- Expired exports are still included in the list

header.description: Expected response content type.
JWT Bearer token for authentication. Must have admin role. Obtained from login or register endpoints.
Optional: Origin header for CORS testing. Enable this header to verify CORS response headers (Access-Control-Allow-Origin, etc.). Disabled by default since Postman doesn't enforce CORS.

request.description:
Delete all CSV files from the exports directory (admin only).

This endpoint deletes all CSV files in the exports directory and optionally cleans up expired export records from the database.

**Response Codes:**
- 200 OK: CSV files deleted successfully
- 401 Unauthorized: Authentication required
- 403 Forbidden: Admin role required
- 500 Internal Server Error: Failed to delete CSV files

**Response Fields:**
- message (string): Success message
- deleted_count (integer): Number of CSV files deleted

**Notes:**
- This endpoint requires admin authentication
- Deletes all CSV files from the exports directory, regardless of ownership
- Optionally cleans up expired export records from the database
- Use with caution as this operation cannot be undone
- Individual file deletion failures are logged but do not stop the overall operation

item.description: Export endpoints for creating CSV exports of selected contacts and companies, listing user exports, and downloading them via signed temporary URLs. All exports include complete contact, company, and metadata information. Admin-only endpoint for CSV cleanup.

{
  "uuid": "f4b8c3f5-1111-4f9b-aaaa-123456789abc",
  "first_name": "Patrick",
  "last_name": "McGarry",
  "company_id": "398cce44-233d-5f7c-aea1-e4a6a79df10c",
  "email": "pat.mcgarry@banduracyber.com",
  "title": "Chief Technology Officer",
  "departments": [
    "C-Suite",
    "Engineering & Technical"
  ],
  "mobile_phone": "+1 937-555-0132",
  "email_status": "Verified",
  "text_search": "Fulton Maryland United States",
  "seniority": "C suite"
}

request.description:
Create a new contact record using the ContactCreate schema. All body fields are optional:
- uuid (string, optional): Contact UUID. If not provided, one will be generated.
- first_name (string, optional): Contact's first name.
- last_name (string, optional): Contact's last name.
- company_id (string, optional): UUID of the related company.
- email (string, optional): Contact's email address.
- title (string, optional): Contact's job title.
- departments (array[string], optional): List of department names.
- mobile_phone (string, optional): Contact's mobile phone number.
- email_status (string, optional): Email verification status.
- text_search (string, optional): Free-form search text, e.g., location information.
- seniority (string, optional): Contact's seniority level.

Requires admin authentication and X-Contacts-Write-Key header.

request.description:
Create a new company record using the CompanyCreate schema. All body fields are optional:
- uuid (string, optional): Company UUID. If not provided, one will be generated.
- name (string, optional): Company name.
- employees_count (integer, optional): Number of employees.
- industries (array[string], optional): List of industries.
- keywords (array[string], optional): List of keywords.
- address (string, optional): Company address.
- annual_revenue (integer, optional): Annual revenue in dollars.
- total_funding (integer, optional): Total funding in dollars.
- technologies (array[string], optional): List of technologies.
- text_search (string, optional): Free-form search text, e.g., location information.
- metadata (object, optional): Company metadata including city, state, country, phone, website, social URLs.

Requires admin authentication and X-Companies-Write-Key header.

formdata.description: Upload the sample CSV located under data/data/apollo_sample_5000_cleaned.csv.

request.description:
Start a background contacts import using a CSV file.

**File Requirements:**
- Format: CSV (Comma-Separated Values)
- File must not be empty
- File name is required

**Request:**
- Content-Type: multipart/form-data (automatically set by Postman)
- Body: Form-data with key "file" and type "file"
- Requires admin authentication

**Response Codes:**
- 202 Accepted: Import job created and queued
- 400 Bad Request: Empty file or missing filename
- 401 Unauthorized: Authentication required
- 403 Forbidden: Admin access required
- 422 Unprocessable Entity: File name is required
- 500 Internal Server Error: Failed to store file or create job

header.description: Expected response content type.
JWT Bearer token for authentication. Obtained from login or register endpoints.
Optional: Origin header for CORS testing. Enable this header to verify CORS response headers (Access-Control-Allow-Origin, etc.). Disabled by default since Postman doesn't enforce CORS.

query.description: Toggle inclusion of row-level error details in the response. When false (default), returns ImportJobDetail. When true, returns ImportJobWithErrors containing an errors array with row-level import errors.

request.description:
Fetch the status of a queued import job without embedded errors.

**Query Parameters:**
- include_errors (boolean, optional, default: false): When false, returns ImportJobDetail. When true, returns ImportJobWithErrors with embedded error payloads.

**Response Codes:**
- 200 OK: Job details retrieved
- 401 Unauthorized: Authentication required
- 404 Not Found: Import job not found

header.description: Expected response content type.
JWT Bearer token for authentication. Obtained from login or register endpoints.

query.description: Toggle inclusion of row-level error details in the response. When true, returns ImportJobWithErrors containing an errors array with row-level import errors. When false (default), returns ImportJobDetail.

request.description:
Fetch the status of a queued import job with embedded error payloads.

**Query Parameters:**
- include_errors (boolean, optional, default: false): When true, returns ImportJobWithErrors with embedded error payloads. When false, returns ImportJobDetail.

**Response Codes:**
- 200 OK: Job details with errors retrieved
- 401 Unauthorized: Authentication required
- 404 Not Found: Import job not found

header.description: Expected response content type.
JWT Bearer token for authentication. Obtained from login or register endpoints.

request.description: Retrieve recorded row-level import errors for the specified job.
